<!-- Please only use this template for submitting enhancement requests -->

**What would you like to be added**: It seems that gRPC plugin doesn't support configuring a timeout and the retries. Also it doesn't fit well with template and cancel plugin :/

In an example configuration:
 ```
solver.example.com {

    template IN SOA {
      authority "{{ .Zone }} 60 IN SOA {{ .Zone }} admin1.{{ .Zone }} (1 60 60 60 60)"
        fallthrough
    }

    template IN A {
      answer "{{ .Name }} 60 IN A 123.123.123.123"
        fallthrough
    }

    log
    errors
    reload
    cancel 2s
    grpc . 127.0.0.1:18853 {
  
    }
}
```

It doesn't respect the cancel context, and spends 5s in a query. As an example:

```
time dig txt  aaa.solver.example.com

real    0m15,035s
user    0m0,014s
sys     0m0,021s

* In CoreDNS Server:
[INFO] 123.123.123.111:11879 - 16332 "TXT IN aaa.solver.example.com. udp 61 false 4096" NOERROR - 0 0.000104219s
[INFO] 123.123.123.111:11879 - 16332 "TXT IN aaa.solver.example.com. udp 61 false 4096" NOERROR - 0 0.000196813s
[INFO] 123.123.123.111:11879 - 16332 "TXT IN aaa.solver.example.com. udp 61 false 4096" NOERROR - 0 0.000105267s
```

So with cancel = 2s it should take max of 6s (as the DNS retries 5 times) but instead it's failing in the client timeout and not answering with an error.

I'm proposing this as a feature so maybe gRPC plugin could support a Dial Timeout (as this is already supported in gRPC client), but it's strange to me that the context timeout is 2s but CoreDNS doesn't answer in this 2s :(

If inserting this as a directive to gRPC plugin is ok to you I can create the PR, otherwise need to discover here why the cancel plugin is not respected by gRPC :)




**Why is this needed**:
title: gRPC plugin support retries and timeout
